geeklist.title: Virtual Flea Market for Delivery to BGG.Spring 2022
geeklist.description:
[ImageID=6878299 original]
[BGCOLOR=#993399][b]Edit:[/b][/BGCOLOR] As promised, the layout for the VFM meetup is above. Be reminded that we will be in the Innovation Ballroom, behind the front desk on the Lobby floor. Sellers will enter through D while buyers will enter through A. Sellers (and their helpers) will be able to enter between 3:00 and 3:45. Buyers will be able to enters between 4:00 and 5:00. Buyers please remember to be on time. Sellers please plan on being present until all of your items are picked up. I will have paper labels on the seller tables. [BGCOLOR=#993399] If you are planning to have a helper, please be sure to send me their name so they can be on the helper list.[/BGCOLOR]
[BGCOLOR=#66FF00][b]EDIT: [/b][/BGCOLOR]As many of you have noticed, the event tickets are now available for buyers and sellers. Seller tickets are available [url=https://tabletop.events/conventions/bgg.spring-2022/schedule/10]here[/url]. Please note, only one ticket is required per table. If you have a helper, they do not need a seller ticket of their own. [BGCOLOR=#66FF00][b]If you have obtained two tickets for a single seller's items, please cancel the second ticket.[/b][/BGCOLOR]
[BGCOLOR=#FFFF00][b]EDIT: Added [url=https://sunderedrealm.com/bgg/bgg-list.php?l=297887&mode=9&sort=0]Dave Rathbun's list[/url] as the summary list for the VFM.[/b][/BGCOLOR] It uses the same markups used in previous years.
It's time to start up the [b]BGG.Spring 2022 Virtual Flea Market[/b]. This is one of my favorite parts of BGG.Con and BGG.Spring. For me this is the real beginning of BGG. Spring. I know many others who feel the same. In order to manage the overall chaos of the event please review the information below. There are some changes since the last time this happened in 2019. Hope everyone has fun. Please start listing games.
[size=18][b][COLOR=#660099]Please read everything before participating![/COLOR][/b][/size]
[size=18][b][u]VFM Delivery Meetup:[/u] Location: Innovation Ballroom (Lobby Level behind Check-in desks) Open for Sellers to setup: Saturday 3:00 PM to 3:45 PM Open for Buyers: Saturday 4:00pm to 5:00 pm [/b][/size] [b]No scheduled early meetup.[/b]
[size=18][b][url=https://sunderedrealm.com/bgg/bgg-list.php?l=297887&mode=9&sort=0]Spring 2022 VFM Index[/url][/b][/size] (Special thanks to Dave Rathbun)
[b][u]Event Tickets[/u][/b]
This is a ticketed event. Participation in the geeklist is open to anyone with a convention badge. However, the meetup swap is open only to those with event tickets. If you are unable to participate in the swap due to not having a ticket (or other reasons) you will need to make other arrangements. This needs to be clearly communicated between buyer and seller before agreeing to a swap. Tickets will need to be obtained through Tabletop Events. For this event there will be 50 seller tickets and 300 buyer tickets available.
[b][u]Masks[/u][/b]
In accordance with BGG.Spring policies, masks are currently "recommended but not required" for this event. Please do not obtain event tickets if you are uncomfortable with this. [BGCOLOR=#FFFF00][b]Please note[/b], this may change between now and the convention.[/BGCOLOR]
[b][u]General[/u][/b]
The primary purpose of the Virtual Flea Market is to arrange the selling of games before arrival at the convention. The original reason for this was the uncertainty of knowing which games might sell at the [i]Bazaar [/i] coupled with limitations on what one could travel with. If you have items that you'd like to sell at BGG.Spring, add a geeklist item including what you wish to sell. Please include the condition of your item and the price or terms you'd like to sell for. With any luck, the deals will be done ahead of the convention and you can just do the physical swap in Dallas.
[b][u]Guidelines[/u][/b]
How you sell your items is up to you! Fixed Price, Auction, Dutch Auction, it doesn't matter. Everyone is on their own - no one will be monitoring your items but you. If you are running an auction, please be sure to define how that auction is going to run, particularly how/when it is going to end.
[b]Please be polite.[/b] Some buyers will make potentially lowball offers. Some sellers won't be interested in making deals. Please be respectful in your interactions.
Please do not delete items once they are added to the list. If an item is no longer available, please edit your listing to indicate it is not available.
[b][u]Delivery Meetup[/u][/b]
As in the past, we have a reserved time and space at BGG.Con Spring to make the swaps. This year's delivery meet up will be in the Innovation Ballroom (on the lobby level behind the check-in desks) on Saturday May 28.
Sellers will be allowed to enter from 3:00 pm until 3:45 pm in order to setup. Current plan if for sellers to enter from Innovation D. Sellers will not be admitted after 3:45. Sellers will be required to have a sellers ticket. These will be limited to a total of 50. If you are unable to obtain a seller's ticket, you must make other arrangements for swapping your games. If you are not going to be able to be at the swap, you need to note this in the item description. By participating in the VFM list as a seller and obtaining a seller's ticket you are agreeing to arrive early to set up. You may bring one helper with you to help out at your table. Do not get a ticket for your helper. Sellers are expected to remain at their table until all items are sold. Based on 2019 numbers, there should be enough seller's tickets for anyone that sells more than 10 items. If you sell fewer than 10 items, please allow those who are selling more items to have first opportunity for seller's tickets.
Buyers will line up at Innovation A. As with sellers, buyers will be required to obtain a buyer's ticket. A seller may not also have a buyer's ticket. If you both buy and sell, you will need someone else to pick up your purchases or make other arrangements. Buyers will be able to enter from 4:00 pm to 5:00 PM. [b]PLEASE BE PROMPT![/b] By participating in the VFM list as a buyer and obtaining a buyer's ticket, you are agreeing to be present no later than 4:00 pm. All sales/purchases are to be completed by 5:00 pm at the latest.
You are, of course, welcome to arrange other times/methods for your swaps on an individual basis (but see the note about an early meetup below).
Team Geek will be present overseeing the meetup. It is expected that all participants will cooperate fully with Team Geek.
[b][u]Delivery Meetup Room Plan[/u][/b]
In order to facilitate the meetup, tables will be assigned to sellers. Each seller with a seller's ticket will receive one table. There will be no sharing of tables. Prior to the convention, the room plan will be posted in this header. Tables will be arranged in alphabetical order by [b]user name[/b]. If you get a seller ticket that does not clearly connect to your user name, please let me know. Tables will be labelled at the time of the meetup.
[u][b]Summary of Unsold Games[/b][/u]
In the past, Steve Duff (Unknown Parker Brother) has put together a list based on code from Ron Parker (parkrrrr) that summarizes the games still unsold. A few years ago, John Munsch (JohnMunsch) put together an alternate list for users of the VFM. At this time, I do not expect either of these to be available this year. However, Dave Rathbun (drathbun) has put together a [url=https://sunderedrealm.com/bgg/bgg-list.php?l=297887&mode=9&sort=0]list[/url] that provides the same information (and more).
[u]In order to keep this list working right, please update your items as follows:[/u]
1. When your item sells, please edit your items entry to include the word "Sold" someplace. (And by extension, don't otherwise include the word "Sold".)
2. If your item is an auction, please include the word "Auction" someplace.
3. If you change your price, please keep the new price on the same line of the geeklist and after the previous price (Do something like [-]$25[/-]$20). Please don't leave space between the "$" and the numbers.
4. If you wish to remove an item from the summary list, add +remove+ in the game's entry. This tag takes precedence over everything else.
5. If you are selling an item that needs an alternate name in the summary list, please place this code in your item someplace: "+altname+ Whatever You'd Like To Call Your Item -altname-"
6. [b]Please don't delete sold items!![/b] Just leave them on the list. Thank you!
7. Please do not mark items as SOLD if they are not actually SOLD
[b][BGCOLOR=#FFFF00]Note from Dave: Remember sometimes the list request fails and the results show up as empty. Please wait a few seconds and try refreshing again.[/BGCOLOR][/b]
In the fall, several other options were available. Some of those are listed below. I am happy to add additional links for any lists that you would like to share. Please send those to me via geekmail.
[url=https://bgg.activityclub.org/tools/vfm.html?listid=297887]JeffyJeff's VFM tool [/url] You will likely get a safety warning related to security certificate. This is a longstanding issue
[url=https://listonaleash.herokuapp.com/geeklist/297887/]List on a Leash[/url]
[url=http://www.grimwold.org.uk/bgg/tools/geeklistBGG.php]Grimwold Geeklist Sorter[/url]. Use geeklist ID 297887
For JeffyJeff's list, you may use the following:
1. If you wish to remove an item from the list, add the word "withdrawn" in the game's entry. This tag takes precedence over everything else.
2. When an item is sold, indicate who the buyer is by using the bgg markup (minus the spaces) either [ user = buyersusername ] or [ username = buyersusername ].
[b][u]Request List[/u][/b]
If there is something you are looking for, think about adding it to the [geeklist=297888][/geeklist].
[u][b]Processing Payments[/b][/u]
Per BGG Guidelines, it is the seller's responsibility to process final sales through the BGG Marketplace. This may be facilitated by use of the Quick Marketplace Listing button below each item. Some people like to do a single lump sum payment either for everything or for items where the buyer did not respond to the listing. In the past I have used a listing under [thing=23953][/thing] for this.
[u][b]Math Trade[/b][/u]
For the past several events, there have been math trades at BGG.Spring. Presumably, there will be another one this year. Historically, there have been concerns about overlap between games on the VFM list and in the math trade. Please use courtesy when considering the two. (Waylander1's advice) "I generally handle my entries as follows: I add my items to the math trade near the end of the math trade listing period. Once I do, I will, most likely, not sell items via this list until the conclusion of the math trade. I think this method limits the amount of conflict between the two lists. I suggest that others adopt a similar plan." Many people will indicate in the description that items will not be available at a certain point due to the math trade. Others will edit the entry to indicate they are no longer available or when they are available again. [u][b]Please[/b][/u] don't delete entries for games that are no longer available. You can add +remove+ to the entry to keep it off of the summary list. You can also edit the entry to indicate it is not available.
[u][b]Early Meetup[/b][/u]
In the past, some of the participants in the Fall VFM have tried to set up an early meetup on the night before the official start of the convention. This has been discouraged for several years now. While individuals getting together to make trades is certainly appropriate, please do not schedule a large-scale early meetup before the start of the convention.
[size=24][b][COLOR=#990099]Please do add your items! The more items, the more interest![/COLOR] [/b][/size]
[COLOR=#FF0000][size=18][b]Please do not delete items once added.[/b][/size] [/COLOR] If an item is no longer available, please edit it to reflect that, but leave it in place. You can add +remove+ to the entry to keep it off the summary list.
[u][b]Additional tips for sellers and buyers:[/b][/u]
[b]Sellers:[/b]
1. Create a spreadsheet with the games your selling. Create columns for Game Name, Game Cost, Method of Payment, Buyer Name, Buyer BGG Name, Comments, etc. If you're paying via PayPal, Venmo, etc. make a note. Print off your list prior to the event and bring it with you.
2. Send out geek mails and confirm with the game sale with people who have bought games from you. Sometimes people miss responses to game transactions. Run your sales through BGG Marketplace either as a lot or individually so BGG can get their cut. It's only fair.
3. Have a full-length, printed sheet with your BGG User Name, Name, and Avatar/Logo on it for people to find you more easily.
4. Print out the table assignments beforehand. Circle your table.
5. Get there right at 3:00 pm to set up your games and table.
6. You must attend the whole hour or until all your games being sold are picked up by Buyers.
7. Team up with a friend (or a few friends) if you are both Buying and Selling games. You cannot be both a Buyer and Seller at the VFM event.
8. Removable Sticky notes on the game with the name of the Buyer picking up your games would be helpful.
9. Please get your money out of the envelopes and deposit the empty envelopes in the trash. Please do not leave it for staff to clean up!
10. Remember it's the most wonderful game time of the year! Be kind, courteous, and try to help others out as possible. This event is super fun!
[b]Buyers:[/b]
1. Create a spreadsheet with the games you're buying. Create columns for Game Name, Game Cost, Method of Payment, Seller Name, Seller BGG Name, Comments, etc. If you're paying via PayPal, Venmo, etc. make a note. Print off your list prior to the event and bring it with you.
2. Buy plain envelopes. Write down the name of each game you're buying and the BGG name of the Seller. Provide exact change. Put your name on your envelopes so it's easily identified as paid by sellers or in case it gets lost.
3. Get there around 3:45 pm and wait in line to get in. Buyers can't go in until 4:00 pm.
4. Bring plenty of bags to haul off your 'new' games. You may not be able to use the luggage carts.
5. Print out the table assignments beforehand. Circle or highlight the tables you need to visit.
6. Remember it's the most wonderful game time of the year! Be kind, courteous, and try to help others out as possible. This event is super fun!
[u]If you found the Spring VFM Index list useful, please consider tipping:[/u]
[floatleft][user=drathbun][/user][/floatleft][clear]
There is a Virtual Flea Market microbadge [microbadge=40047] Get one and show your support for the VFM!

How do we code for an Alternate Title so it will appear on the searchable list differently?

[q="okiedokie"]How do we code for an Alternate Title so it will appear on the searchable list differently?[/q] For the list that I am hosting, I took the rules from another similar function...simply surround your alternate text with [b]+altname+ Your alternate text here -altname-[/b] and it will show up on the list only using your alternate phrasing. It's a great way to indicate that you have a bundle of games + expansions.
For example
[c]+altname+ Terraforming Mars With Prelude -altname- +altname+ Terraforming Mars With All Expansions -altname- [/c]
Or whatever you like. :) Please send me a Geek Mail if you see any weirdness. Also please know that games starting with "A" or "AN" or "THE" are alphabetized by ignoring those leading words. So "A Feast For Odin" shows up under "F" rather than "A" on the list.

[q="GWGumby"]There is a specific link to look at all your list items without having to scroll through pages. Unfortunately I can’t find it. I just have one for looking at the items I’ve commented on.
Does anyone have the link format for viewing your own posts (that also shows the comments?)[/q]
https://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/items/user/[b]YourUsernameHere[/b]?domain=boardgame
Example - https://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/items/user/Cheelara1?domain=boardgame
You can get there by: 1. Selecting the drop down arrow to the right of your username in the upper-right hand corner of the screen, then selecting "Profile". 2. From the "Profile" page, select "Contributions". 3. From the "Contributions" page, within the right frame, under the section titled "Geeklists" click on the number to the right of "Geeklist Items". This will load a page showing the last 25 geeklist items you have added to any geeklist.
If you want to track all the game listings you have "commented" on, repeat the steps above except, on step 3, find the section in the right frame titled "Comments" select the number to the right of "Geeklist Item Comments".
Thank you

I have identified a bug in the search / list tool. There is a particular seller that has links to another Geek List within his posts. The URL for that Geek List includes the word "unsold" which, unfortunately, includes the word "sold" in it. That violates the rule: [q]1. When your item sells, please edit your items entry to include the word "Sold" someplace. (And by extension, don't otherwise include the word "Sold".)[/q] Even though the word is actually "unsold" that includes "sold" and then, well, you already know. :)
I tried to add a space to the word, so I look for " sold" but that doesn't work either, because a lot of folks put "Sold to..." at the beginning of a line.
Ultimately it's difficult to work with unstructured data. That's why it's nice to have +remove+ as a remove tag, and +altname+ for alternate titles. It would be much more reliable to use the tag +sold+ to mark sold items, as that string of text is not likely to appear by accident. For now, as has been mentioned, if the word "sold" appears anywhere in the text - even if it's hidden within a URL - it's going to think your item has been sold.
I will consider options to try to work around this case and see what I can do!
Any way to if/then it? if == "sold" and != "unsold"

[q="wandererwillow"]Any way to if/then it? if == "sold" and != "unsold"[/q] Excellent suggestion, and one I had considered. However, I hesitated to actually make the change because it opens up an entire mess for additional words like "oversold" or "resold" or "undersold" or even "soldier" that also include the letters s-o-l-d.
I think the poster who embedded "unsold" in his Geek List links has changed them, so that particular issue is avoided for now. :)
What's the scripting language? Let me see if there's a good solution, I love coding problem solving.
[q="wandererwillow"]What's the scripting language? Let me see if there's a good solution, I love coding problem solving.[/q] The page is written in PHP.

Okay, so...
I [i]think[/i] you can do a regexp and then use a ^ at the start to denote when it's at the start of a line. Then, use a string with a space at the start, just in case.
So if == ^"sold" or if == " sold" then it should search for any instance its the start of a statement or if there's a space before, removing any chances for words prior.
If you want to avoid things like "soldier" I think there's a way to mark a string to avoid with a range of characters, I forget if it's [a-z] so NOT "sold[a-z]" but I'd have to look further. I believe the above with the carrot or space should handle the more common uses.

@wanderwillow thanks for the suggestion!
I will take the conversation to GM as I imagine most folks are not interested in reading tech-babble stuff. :)

Hi folks, in my continuing efforts to improve the experience for the indexing tool, I have added a "retry" loop at the top of the code. It will attempt to pull the list via the BGG API, check that it got a good return result, and render the list. If it does not get a good return result, it will sleep for 3 seconds and try again. The problem is it doesn't tell you that it's doing that, so it just looks like it's taking a long time to render. Once it has succeeded (or failed completely) then you'll see the notes about retrying.
I will figure out a better way to manage this, but for now I'll stick with this new approach unless folks don't like it.

As the action heats up (new folks are posting items, old listings are being sold or price reduced) I thought of an enhancement I could make to the index tool that I maintain. Currently new items (posted in the last 48 hours) are highlighted with a green background when you look at the Available list or the All Items list. There were a lot of updates today, and I found myself clicking through the Geek List quite a bit!
So now the index tool will highlight items that have been [b]updated[/b] in the last 48 hours in a lighter yellow shaded background. There is also a new menu choice that will let you show only items that have been updated in the last 48 hours. Items that are new are specifically eliminated from the Updated list, meaning an item that is New will not also be seen as Updated.
Put another way. When an item is added to the VFM, it will stay "New" (green) for 48 hours. Even if it's sold during that 48 hours it will be shown as green.
Once that 48 hours has passed, if the item is updated (new description notes, lowered price, whatever it might be) then it will show up as Yellow, and also on the Updated list. That way if you want to quickly and easily see everything that has been updated in the last 48 hours, you can now do so.
As always, thoughts or suggestions or bug reports are welcomed. :cool:

I'm experimenting with the list format for prices a bit. The initial process I used to find prices was okay, but fragile. The new process will identify any set of numbers in the post that starts with a dollar sign $ and assume it's a price. Prices are listed from left to right in the order they are found within the post.
For example, this shows an item that was initially priced at $30 that is now available for $25. Or at least that is the implication. :) [c]$30/$25[/c] This is an auction item. The price values are identified in order, as such: [c]$5.00./$1/$10.00 (Auction)[/c] The opening bid is $5, the bid increment is $1, and the BIN (Buy It Now) is $10. If the posts follow this format, it will include the word "auction" along with those prices. This one: [c]$25/$20/$20[/c] ...shows an opening price of $25, reduced price of $20, and a sold price of $20.
In my old version I tried to recreate the strike-out format. I may try to recreate that but for now it's not on the list output. The pricing data right now is stored as a string. I plan to capture the last price and convert it to a number so I can do math later. I'm assuming the last price I find is the final sale price.
Finally, this one threw me for a loop when I saw it. :) [c]$45/$90/$100/$45/$50[/c] Prices were all over the board, and very confusing. If you look at the post you'll see what is going on. :)
https://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/297887/item/8933772#item8933772

A little history: It’s interesting because the Bazaar actually came first. But back then, it was called the Flea Market. It was an absolute madhouse. I mean that in the best possible way. Tables were jammed together and piled high with games. Sellers were like carnival barkers, sometimes yelling across the room at potential buyers, competing with other sellers for their business. Buyers were herded through like cattle. If you saw something you wanted, you had to grab it quickly, or risk your life trying to turn around and work against the stream of traffic. I am being a little hyperbolic. But it really was crazy. I wouldn’t want to go back to those days. But it was a lot of fun. Anyway, at some point, someone had the great idea to prearrange the sales using a geek list. The Virtual Flea Market was born. To avoid confusion, the normal Flea Market had its name changed to the Bazaar. Many sellers bring their games that don’t sell on the VFM to the Bazaar. I did that for a year or two. But I think I’m over that now.
My memory isn’t the best. If I got any of that wrong, I hope some other old timer will chime in and correct me, or add their memories.

your basically correct. Though spring was never the crazy bazaar november was. Spring was a nice square that had a decent amount of traffic and you could make a loop or two usually in the hour without much issue.

Way back when we had several rooms, one with a grand piano and then there was the one year the band for a wedding reception came in the wrong door and had to carry their instruments across the entire hotel, threading their way between two long lines of gamers waiting to get in the Bazaar.
And it was a mariachi band!

Here's the short version: Someone deleted some items from the Geek List. For people who track their items by item [b]number[/b] that's a huge problem. For folks that track things by item [b]ID[/b] not so much. What is the item number and how is it different from the item ID? Glad you asked 🙂 If you don't care, skip the rest of this comment.
An Item [b]Number[/b] is generated sequentially as entries are added to the Geek List. Obviously the first item on the list is Item Number 1, and the latest entry (as I type this) is Item Number 3036. The problem is, these numbers are transient. If an item is removed, then every entry added after that gets their item number reduced by 1. Or more specifically, by the number of deleted items. In the case I investigated this morning, there were 7 items removed, so item number 2007 (for example) is now item number 2000.
As of this post, there were 3036 items on the list. The Item [b]ID[/b] for number 1 is 8879392 and the Item [b]ID[/b] for number 3036 is 8955686. Item ID values never change. BGG uses Item ID to uniquely identify any entry in their database. If you bookmark or subscribe something, it's done by Item ID and not Geek List Number. How can you use this?
What I do when I list (or buy) items is copy the hyperlink to that item, as it includes the Item ID and not the Item Number and then I save that in a spreadsheet. For example here is the link for the current first item on this list [c]/geeklist/297887/virtual-flea-market-delivery-bggspring-2022?itemid=8879392[/c] Here's a link to one of the items I am selling [c]/geeklist/297887/virtual-flea-market-delivery-bggspring-2022?itemid=8931794[/c] The Item ID is the very last part of that URL, either 8879392 or 8931794.
If you were impacted by the item deletion, here's what I might suggest. If you go to my index tool and use the "All" option and select User Sort then you'll get a list of every single item on the list, grouped by user name. You can then copy the rows that belong to you and paste them into a spreadsheet (Excel or Google Sheets both work equally well). Then you have a list that you can sort / filter / edit but more importantly it contains a link to every one of your items on this Geek List. And those hyperlinks will not break, even if someone deletes items.
Has anyone heard about table assignments yet?

I have revised the code that tries to see if something is sold or not. It seems to do a much better job of ignoring misleading text. For example someone listed a game with "soldier" as part of the name, and it was inappropriately identified as sold. That's definitely fixed as "soldier" was one of my test cases, along with "unsold" and "xxsoldxx" just for good measure. I know that's not a word. 🙂 Also someone had created a Geek List for their unsold items...because the word "sold" was embedded within the URL as part of the word "unsold" all of their items were tagged as being sold. (sorry 😞). They fixed their links, but now they should work.
Going forward, the most reliable way to mark something sold is to use the tag [b]+sold+[/b] just like we have +remove+ and +altename+ to mean special things. Seeing [b]+sold+[/b] is reliable, safe, and automatic. If that tag is not found, I still scan the text looking for the bare word "sold" in some context, using more robust logic now.
As always, if you encounter any issues or bugs, or have suggestions, please let me know.
is +sold+ case sensitive? Does +Sold+ work?

[q="GWGumby"]is +sold+ case sensitive? Does +Sold+ work?[/q] It's not supposed to be case sensitive. So +sold+ or +SOLD+ or +Sold+ or even the odd but recognizable +soLD+ should all work. 🙂
For that matter, none of the tags (at least with my index) are case sensitive, so +REMOVE+ and +remove+ are functionally identical.

Are there instructions on how to "run your sales through BGG Marketplace either as a lot or individually"?

[q="steentx"]Are there instructions on how to "run your sales through BGG Marketplace either as a lot or individually"? [/q] Each of your listings should have a button that says "Add GeekMarket Listing". That will allow you to do each sale individually. It also has the added advantage of adding the sales to price history. For payment as a lot, you can create an item such as outside the scope of BGG and have it sold. You can also make a direct payment to BGG for 3% of the total sales price. There are probably other ways.

To be clear - the change is from 3% to 8% - plus you have to use Stripe which charges 2.9% + $0.30.
The argument is the same that eBay made when they forced everyone over to doing bank drafts and upping their charges... As a seller, you are still paying the same amount or less.... except for things like the VFM where 90%+ of the transactions are cash at con. We don't have additional charges for those transactions.
Oh, and because it is Stripe, you'll get a 1099 for your taxes.

[q="drathbun"]More details on the updates coming to the BGG Marketplace https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/2836136/join-our-new-boardgamegeek-market[/q]
So from reading this link a few observations:
1. Commission structure changes to include Stripe (third party) commission 2.9% + $0.30 AND new BGG commission 8%. Previously (or currently) BGG commission is 3% paid by Sellers.
2. Stripe requires amongst other information your social security number according to one user.
3. Have to pre-pack the parcel to get size and weight before you list the game.
4. At one point couldn’t use your own shipping labels. Unclear if you have to still use the BGG label when shipping in future. You print the label yourself. (So add ink and paper as costs now too?)
5. Shipping not available outside the US. Unclear if this is permanent or just a test market.
6. Sellers will be forced to accept returns. Although to be fair you get 3 days once game is delivered. This could potentially lead to switcheroo scams where people buy like new games and return one in much worse condition.
7. Lose the ability to sell locally for no-shipping and cash sales.
8. Unclear but could lead to the reduction in participation of Math Trades, Virtual Flea Markets, and/or BGG Users offloading games via a GeekList.
9. Unclear if previous BGG user ratings/feedback will cary over to new system.
10. Unclear if previous BGG price history will carry over to new system.
Added per James Perry observation: 11. Also Stripe will kindly provide you a 1099 for your taxes. This likely is why #2 is required.

As I see it, for the VFM the only thing BGG is providing is a message board. They're not facilitating the selling / shipping / payment of games as everything is going to be exchanged in person at the event. If we want a VFM, there are plenty of options that can be used as a substitute message board. Some of the local Dallas folks are already listing stuff in duplicate on Facebook as an alternative option. (I know not everybody is on, or likes FB, but it's an option.)
I view the overhaul of the marketplace as a completely separate area of discussion, as it has a broader function than facilitating a virtual flea market.

Per Jeff: The Bazaar is a free event that added to the experience of the con. The VFM utilized the website and geeklists and is expected that transactions and commissions are processed through the marketplace.
Bazaar = free VFM = marketplace
If someone WANTS to donate/process Bazaar sales through the Marketplace, they can but it is not expected/required.

[q="okiedokie"]Per Jeff: The Bazaar is a free event that added to the experience of the con.[/q] The way I see it, the Bazaar is not really free...it's available to people who have paid for a pass to the convention. In that regard, it's identical to the VFM, which also requires buyers or sellers to have a pass to the convention. The primary difference to my way of looking at it is that the VFM allows buyers and sellers to pre-connect, saving some of the chaos of the Bazaar. Which is basically a message board, as I mentioned earlier. 🙂

Hey I see you needed help with cancelling your sellers ticket on TTE. So here's the step by step:
1. Go to https://tabletop.events/ & login
2. Then click on Attend --> My Schedule
[ImageID=6874697 Medium]
3. Then click on your name
[ImageID=6874698 Medium]
4. Then on the bottom right you should be able to see your TTE events.
5. Click the Red "Delete" button next to the VFM Sellers ticket event.
[ImageID=6874699 Medium]
I hope this helps! Game on :)

Given the way BGG is handling comments to geeklists these days, this post got buried pretty quickly, so I'm re-posting it.

The VFM has been a lot of fun this year, though a bit less "chatty" than previous years. Maybe it's a function of the number of participants. Maybe it's just a more stressful time. I'm not sure. But I'm thankful for everyone who purchased games from me and looking forward to picking up all my new treasures.

That went better than expected. I'll try one more:
[Url=https://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/297887/virtual-flea-market-delivery-bggspring-2022?itemid=8879448#8879448]Battles on the Ice: Defeats of the Livonian Order at Peipus and Karuse[/Url] (Remember, this didn't come with the map, so I'll include a photocopy of the map)

These are the users that I have listed as having helpers:
adamxpaul cheelara1 deitied drathbun eisen29 goodemailaddress GWGumby jeffreystephens jmangus okiedokie otscotty punkin312 regai rtho25 Saca_Muela seandlh settlerdave timeto316
It is certainly possible that I have deleted some by accident. If you are not on this list and intend to have a helper, please send me a geekmail with the name of your helper.

I believe I have reached out to everyone that I am either buying from or selling to. If I am buying from or selling to you and you have not heard from me, please send me a geekmail. I look forward to seeing you all at the con.
I as well have sent message to all my buyers so my stuff are not closed loading up the car as we speak

Late to the party here, but I've added some games and commented on some that I'd like to buy. I'll plan to have the games I've listed in my car. Just let me know if you'd like one and I'll be sure to bring it up when/wherever we meet.

I have also sent messages out to all who bought from me. I did not receive many messages from those I bought from though. If you have bought something and I did not respond please let me know before 11 today.

I have made envelopes with cash for those I am buying from, and I have change for cash purchases for those buying from me. I am also bringing my extra unsold Carcassonne expansions, so if you have $10 burning a hole in your pocket come by and see me at the VFM. 🙂 I do not currently plan to be selling at the Bazaar. See y'all Saturday!

I sent a message to everyone I (believe I) bought games from that I'll be at the Delicious Doom Chocolates booth in the Exhibitor Hall. If you want to meet up prior to the VFM, come find us. We're right at the entrance of the hall.
(Also if you ask nicely I may let you peek at the board games we brought for the bazaar that I was too busy to throw onto the VFM)

What a fantastic experience! Thanks to everyone who listed, who bartered, who bargained, who spent, who regretted too much spending, who showed up at the actual event, and who is now hopefully playing some re-homed games. Woo!
I did have one person stop by my table to ask about the "Half as Wild" Carcassonne expansions. It turns out that both of them had previously sold, and that's why I didn't have an extra copy in my box. I apologize, as I forgot your name, but maybe you will see this...
I'm not going to be at BGG.Spring this year, so I'm hoping someone else will step up and runs the VFM. Any volunteers?

[q="seppo21"]I'm not going to be at BGG.Spring this year, so I'm hoping someone else will step up and runs the VFM. Any volunteers?[/q]
Oh! I was wondering why we hadn't seen anything yet. You will be missed Stephen!

item.body:
EDIT: It's double posting for me again, and I have no idea why. Mods can delete this if they want.
+remove+
[size=18][b][b]SOLD for $25[/b][/b][/size]
item.comment: Would you consider $20 for Ortus Regni? Thanks!

I may change my mind if no one else buys it. I'll get back to you if so. But I think I'd prefer to keep it at that point. I don't like selling for less than half the cost, and this was $60 originally. I'll let you know closer to con time! Thanks.

Adam,
Certainly understand. I'll up my bid to $25 to meet in the middle if you'd be willing to part with it for that.
All my best! Phil
Hi Phil, if you're still interested for $25, it's yours.
I'll take it for $25! Thanks!

item.body:
[size=18][b]SOLD for $30[/b][/size]
This is for a lot of over 70 decks, plus tokens. The decks range from the first set to the last one and everything in between.
Edit: By request, here are images showing all the deck names. Sorry I haven't taken the time to type them out, but they're all searchable in the Keyforge database if you want to look them up.
https://ibb.co/mDQcyqZ https://ibb.co/dQjQWg9 https://ibb.co/GQ9qFN8 https://ibb.co/48NQXnK https://ibb.co/c2h5Vm9
I will add a few more decks in that aren't pictured, too, but it's just a handful.
item.comment: I'll start off with $30.

By request, here are images showing all the deck names. Sorry I haven't taken the time to type them out, but they're all searchable in the Keyforge database if you want to look them up.
https://ibb.co/mDQcyqZ https://ibb.co/dQjQWg9 https://ibb.co/GQ9qFN8 https://ibb.co/48NQXnK https://ibb.co/c2h5Vm9
After looking through them, some highlights that came to mind: two Horsemen decks (Browning the Regularly Bizarre, one of my favorite names, and Justice Hall Baronette), a Niffle Kong deck (Yaniz, Refinery Miller), a Quixxle Stone deck (Kravapost, the Elite Acropolis Monk), and one with about 10 artifacts (Iris, Mulish Pyramid Fanatic) that's fun but not necessarily great.
Sold for $30 to Traditz. Thanks.

item.objectname: A Fake Artist Goes to New York
item.body: [size=18][b]SOLD for $5 [/b][/size]
item.comment: How much use has this had? Pens still good? Papers?

Glad you asked. Didn't think to check that. I just tested them all, and thankfully the pens are all looking good still! The pad of papers has plenty left, well over half of what it came with.
Also, I should have noted before, this is the original, small box version, not the bigger one they released later. Personally, I liked the restraint of the tiny pad, but some don't.
I will take it for $5
Thanks!
Put me next in line if this falls through.

item.body:
[size=18][b]SOLD for $20[/b][/size]
As this is a collectible game, this is a lot of assorted cards and dice that would not be worth the effort to catalog. However, I will do my best to paint a picture of what you'd be getting:
Included are several decks I put together but mostly didn't get to try. I bought a few draft sets to do a 2P sealed game, and my friend afterward gave me his collection, which I believe was mostly just the two-player starter set and a few boosters.
item.comment: I'll take this for $20.
Thanks!

item.objectname: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game
item.body:
[size=18][b]SOLD for $40[/b][/size]
This is a lot of cards mixed together, including three copies of the core set, at least one of the big box expansions, and at least one full cycle of the small box expansions. All the decks I made are still separated for you to jump right in, including at least one deck for each faction (more for one or two of them that I had big box expansions for).
item.comment: I'll take it for $40.
Thanks!

item.body:
[size=18][b]SOLD for $5[/b][/size]
IMPORTANT NOTE: This is for the old CCG by AEG, not the more recent LCG by FFG (which I have a separate item listed above for).
This item is three decks I made, all of them together for $5. One is Dragon Clan (monks, enlightenment victory plan). One is Scorpion Clan (ninjas, military victory plan). And one is Mantis Clan (kitsune, honor victory plan). I do not still have any loose cards in my collection, just these decks.
item.comment: Will take these.
Sold, thanks!

item.body:
[size=18][b]SOLD for $15[/b][/size]
By the way, if you buy this, consider signing up for the Captain Sonar tournament at this con and letting the organizer know if you'd be willing to bring this copy for it! It's [i]such[/i] a fun time, and I hope to participate in it again this year. I just have no use for an 8P game in my local group anymore.
item.comment:
Would you take $15 to the person who runs that tournament?
Micahel Grinnan
Oh, absolutely! Thanks, for the purchase and for running the event.
You coming again this year?
I plan to. I'll sign up when I'm certain. Still trying to find out if enough of my friends are joining me or if I'll have to make some new friends at the con. :)

item.body: +remove+
item.comment: Edit: Removing this item. Gave to a friend.

item.body:
[size=18][b]SOLD for $25[/b][/size]
This item is complete, but the box is a masterpiece of bad design. I'm not sure I'll be able to close everything back into it, so some items may be in a separate bag (which is how I store it currently). Also, the (very unnecessary) legs for holding up the second story board do not work and have never worked. Both of these issues are common for the game (see its forums), so it's not that I'm selling a rare misprint. I just want to be upfront about the condition. I've played it just once.
item.comment: Sold, thanks!

Sorry for the late response. I'd trade this for Medium, if you're so inclined.
Actually, I gave Medium away, sorry

No problem. I'm not looking to go lower on this one. I'm getting Nanga Parbat from you for $10. I'd be up for considering these a trade instead, but otherwise, I think I'll hold onto it.
I appreciate the offer.

item.body:
[size=18][b]SOLD for $5[/b][/size]
This is for two playmats for Battlecon. They originally came in the 1st edition Devastation of Indines Kickstarter bundle with a third half-playmat that I've since misplaced. Anyway, it was weird to have three half mats in the first place. (The one missing is the one featuring Heketch.)
If you play Battlecon but aren't familiar with this, each mat is the size of a regular, full-sized playmat, but it covers only your half of the board. You put them together to make one full board / playmat.
item.comment: I'll take these!
Thanks! Sold!

item.body:
[size=13][-]$25[/-][/size][size=18][b]$20[/b][/size]
This is for a singleton* collection. It includes the base game and several expansions (all the packs from Tyrants and Pantheon, and I think something else but it's hard to check with it all mixed up together). All cards that would go into your deck (i.e. not token creatures or god cards) are sleeved in the official Epic sleeves, and the collection is all stored in the long cardboard collector's box with the T-Rex on the cover. The base game box is inside and used to keep the tokens and gods separate.
*If you're not familiar with Epic, there are a few ways to play. If you want to construct your own decks, you can have up to 3 copies of each card in the deck, so you need to buy each set 3 times. If you just want to play draft or random decks, you just need 1 copy of everything you want to include, which is what I have here.
item.comment: Reduced to $20. This is my minimum.

item.body:
This listing is for the "New Arrival 1" level of pledge from:
https://gamefound.com/projects/the-city-of-games/the-isle-of-cats-dont-forget-the-kittens/
[size=18]In shrink. Price $200 Firm.[/size]
Meetup outside VFM only because this is my only listing. Explanation on the firm requirement below:
This pledge level includes the following:
The Big '2-minute' Box Late Arrivals expansion The Isle of Cats game Kittens + Beasts expansion Boat Pack expansion Kickstarter Pack 1 expansion Kickstarter Pack 2 expansion
A couple of months ago, I received a 25 pound box containing my pledge. However, I also received an additional 25 pound box for free due to shipping error. In other words, I receive two copies of my pledge having only paid for one.
After conferring with both City of Games and with Quartermaster Logistics, the decision was made to attempt to give the box away to a game club in my area. But there isn't really a suitable choice here. So I've decided to instead sell it, with the intent of donating the proceeds of the sale to the Jack Vasel Foundation.
Because I won't be keeping the money myself, please show a sense of generosity and meet the price if you are interested, instead of attempting to haggle.
Upon taking possession, you will receive the original shipping box, size 20x16x15 inches. The box has been opened to verify the error, but the contents inside are still in shrink.

Includes ambassadors and expanding the alliance expansions, weiss promo, and revival
$40
Sold to: [user=asgrant67][/user]
item.comment: If you can confirm that all of that is complete, base and expansions, with all components, pieces, cards, etc... I am in for $40. Is this all in one box?
yes it's all in one box. i'll verify it's all there and get back to you

It's all there all the components except base game are still in shrink.
So sold to you

item.comment: What are the names of the decks in this Keyforge package?

[q="Zafin"]What are the names of the decks in this Keyforge package?[/q]Great question. Sorry, I should have thought to post that. It actually has a few bonus decks included. I guess I should just list the decks by name and 15-digit code? Let me know if there is another way I can identify these decks for you.
Opened: Radiant Argus the Supreme Miss "Onyx" Censorius Erabelle, Beaker of the Mellow Bar (3RHR4 3JR3J CX3QC) DuMorn, the Alpha of Nature (335HR 3W6QG 4RW88) Jonapear, the Fighter of Ciphilids (384RQ FX435 MHC7Q)
Okay thanks are these Keyforge decks all registered?

[q="Zafin"]Okay thanks are these Keyforge decks all registered?[/q]I’ll have to admit to some ignorance here. I’m not exactly sure what that means. But, I did enter them into the Keyforge website. Hope that helps.
[ImageID=6815141]

[q="Zafin"]What are the names of the decks in this Keyforge package?[/q]I found two more unopened decks that I forgot I had:
[u]Unopened[/u] Coptivicious, the Aqueous Spire Miner (3QP42 CJF4H JFWM6) Untidy Cleopatra of the Tavern (37RVC HCMV8 64M4W)

item.body:
[size=18][b]Sold[/b][/size] to @Traditz
Never used $30
item.comment: Offering $10
I won't take less than $30 for this.

It's a beautiful mat. And it provides a much nicer environment to play the combined game than trying to keep different game boards together. When I bought mine, I took some pictures that compare the board to the mat, as sometimes people feel that a board can hold a higher resolution print. I actually think they did a great job on the mat. [imageid=4994493 medium] [imageid=4994492 medium] [imageid=4994491 medium] [imageid=4994490 medium]

Fair enough, I didn't realize just how much better it actually looked and was thinking of it as more of a novelty.
I'll take it for asking, $30.
Thanks!
Sold to @Traditz ! Thanks Dave for the extra hype 😂 I had someone who was offering me $30 to ship it, but I'm happier to trade it in person.

Unsolicited plug: This is a fun / light game with a unique art treatment from Miquel Coimbra. It has a dragon on the cover, so it's already in my collection. 😉 In the game each player is a story teller that is trying to create a prescribed condition on the board by adding tiles to the land, or moving the knight or princess or dragon. Once the "dragon can see the princess" or the "knight is on a long river" then you've completed that part of the story and you draw another card. First player to finish their story is the winner. It's definitely worth $5!
$10 for this and GFTH below?
Okay, thanks.

item.body:
[-]$10[/-]$5
Cash at the con
item.comment:
If you don't know anything about this game, I think it's a great set-collection, hand-management, filler card game for 2 players.
You're creating sets of MahJong cards. From each set, you'll keep one card for scoring purposes. The first player in each round to create 5 sets, will win the round, and score the 5 saved cards.
Different combinations of cards will score differently. You're looking to create unique combinations of scoring cards, something like in [thing=215][/thing].
Anyway, this would be great to add to any collection for $5.
Full disclosure: Jeffrey is a personal friend. But I'm only saying this because of how much my wife and I have enjoyed this game through the years.
I'll take this for $3.
It's yours!

[b]$55[/b]
item.comment: Sooch, if you want to play this at the convention, let me know! I will bring my copy which includes both expansions and the playmat! That way you can decide if you want to keep it or sell it at some future time...

I appreciate the offer, but everything in my sell pile was considered [i]extensively[/i] before deciding to sell. I played someone else's copy and despite liking it myself, the rest of my group wasn't feeling it. I'd actually be down to play a game, but better to use the library's copy than to travel with more games than you need to travel with.
I'm local (list just north of Dallas) so I plan to bring whatever I want. :) But yes, a library copy would work too.

item.objectname: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Quick-Start Insert
item.body:
The no longer produced Daedalus insert for Robinson Crusoe. This insert is already assembled. If you buy one of my other Robinson Crusoe items, this one will be $5 off. If you buy both, this will be included for free.
[b]$15[/b]
item.comment:
Sooch, I have been following this item, and trying to research / understand it. Most inserts that I am familiar with are designed for a specific size and shape of a box. This one claims to work with either the square or the older rectangle shaped box. I have the older Z-Man box, and have considered making a foam core insert for it. I prefer wood because it's thinner and looks better. :)
Do you have any pictures of how it fits in the box? The one video I found here on BGG showed how to put it together, and they sort of tried to show how it fits in a box by putting everything into a tape outline on the table.

[q="drathbun"]Sooch, I have been following this item, and trying to research / understand it. Most inserts that I am familiar with are designed for a specific size and shape of a box. This one claims to work with either the square or the older rectangle shaped box. I have the older Z-Man box, and have considered making a foam core insert for it. I prefer wood because it's thinner and looks better. :)
Do you have any pictures of how it fits in the box? The one video I found here on BGG showed how to put it together, and they sort of tried to show how it fits in a box by putting everything into a tape outline on the table.[/q] Bump for visibility in case you missed the question...thanks!

Hello, I did miss your question earlier, so sorry! So this thread has the best pictures I can find: https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/2173773/daedalus-insert The way the pieces are shaped, they will fit into either the older rectangle box or the newer square box. The company went out of business or I'd be able to show you the photos they used to have on their website. Do you have the square box or the rectangle box? If you like, I can try to arrange them in the shape of the box you have to try and take a picture, but I don't have an opened copy to actually put them inside the box.
I have the older rectangular box from Z-Man. I will have a look at the pictures using the link you provided, thanks!
Dave if you're still interested in this, it's yours for $10

What do you think about tossing this in for free if I buy Gates of Loyang (NIS) for your asking price of $60? https://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/297887/virtual-flea-market-delivery-bggspring-2022?itemid=8902953#8902953
Bold! How about $65 for both
[q="Sooch"]Bold! How about $65 for both[/q] I think I have just hit my "number" after buying a Memoir '44 bundle from LoneStarMeeple, so I am done with purchases for this VFM. Thanks!
Sounds good, enjoy the con!

item.comment:
Unsolicited plug: This is a really fun game (in my opinion) and relatively scientifically accurate to boot. It's a steal at $3. I initially found the iconography to be a bit wonky but there is a quick reference sheet in the Files section for the game that helps.
[b]Tim[/b], if they don't sell by the convention I will take both copies at $5 to give as gifts, but I'll allow some time for others to take advantage of your prices first.
thanks

item.comment: This is a surprisingly fun game that someone pulled out at a game night a few months ago and I immediately went home and procured. If you’re not familiar with this game, it’s an awesome buy at $8! Great for non-gamers and enough meat on the bones to keep gamers interested.

I'll take it. I do remember liking it when we played a few years ago at BGG. And I'm always happy to add a game that accommodates 5 players and can be taught quickly.
Thanks to ShakinBlake84 for bringing this entry to my attention.
Medieval Academy for $8 from Tim lathrop (timeteo316)

item.comment:
I’ve never seen the movie, Top Gun. Whenever it’s referenced, my wife always shakes her head and says, “I can’t believe you haven’t seen it.” So, it would make for a fun and surprising date night for us to play this game and watch the dumb movie. The only problem with this plan is that I would probably then be obligated to take her to see the upcoming sequel. But, that’s a sacrifice I’m willing to make for love.
I’ll take it for $10.

item.objectname: The Thin Red Line: A Game of the Battle of Waterloo
item.body:
$30
THE THIN RED LINE - A game of the Battle of Waterloo By Yaquinto Games 1979
The box is in fair shape and the box is intact. Lots of shelf wear.
The contents though are VG/VG+. The game map is in great shape as are the counters. Very vibrant colors on the counters with no wear, sharp edges to the counters.
The staples are still intact on the rulebook and the player record sheets are still intact and unused. There are several photo copies of the charts and two laminated record sheets.
I counted over 300 counters, the box says 300 counters. I am assuming it is complete. I could not find a list of what should be in the box to verify each piece and counter wa

$100
VG+/Excellent condition. Avalon Hill First Edition. Counter sheet only 1/2 punched!
Played once. Box contents are NM/Mint. Game Box is VG. One small dent on side top edge of box cover. Slight white on the edge corners. No fading or shelf wear on box cover face or box cover back.

This is an accidental duplicate post for item 729. Please forgive my mistake.
item.comment: please don't relist things.
My apologies. I didn't think I had listed this already. I should have been more careful.

no worries with the aggregate list if people start relisting games (which has happened in prior years) it really messes with things.
also if you write sold it'll clear this item on the aggregate list.

I considered marking it as sold but felt it would add to the confusion if people were just browsing the normal geeklist (since it hasn't really sold). Hoping the strikethrough helps to indicate the mistake well enough. It would be nice to have a way to have the item ignored without deleting it entirely (which I know is a no-no)
If you want to remove it from the summary list, don't use the word "sold" use the tag +remove+ anywhere in your post and it will be dropped. :)
Done, thanks for the tip!

item.comment: Would you consider $10?
Thanks for the offer, but I am going to hang on this game unless it sells for $15.

I love this game. I sold my Treefrog edition when 2nd edition came out. It is streamlined. But I’m not sure I prefer it. For me, actually building on the map was just more satisfying than the Borough cards. Anyway, if you don’t own this game, don’t think that you necessarily have to get the newest edition. It’s fine. But the Treefrog edition definitely has its charm, and may actually be better. This is certainly worth $15.

I will consider offers; I am much more likely to accept bundle offers for multiple games.
[b]Sold[/b] to:
[username=ThorPowers]
item.comment: Do you know if this would match up with the version of the base game from Hasbro/Wizards of the Coast?
I have to admit that I do not know, as I have not seen that version of the base game. I haven't heard of any such problems with the expansions not being compatable, though.
Thanks for the reply, I'll do some research.
I’ll offer $12 for this.
Brian, I am going to keep this expansion if it doesn't sell for $25 (or a closer price), given that it would likely not be easy to reacquire.

Let me think about it and research more. I have the original game and the first expansion but I'm not sure about the 1 versus others that this brings to the table. Going to $18 or so might be all I should do unless my other items sell for more soon.

item.comment: Hi Gene Platt (parliboy), would you take $50 for Walnut Grove?
[q="deitied"]Hi Gene Platt (parliboy), would you take $50 for Walnut Grove?[/q] It's worth $75. Rare. Out of print. To bad so many people don't want to play it. :zombie:

[q]It's worth $75. Rare. Out of print.[/q]
True... but it's only worth $75 if people are willing to pay $75 for it. Hopefully you're right, and people will have no problem paying $60.
As to the $50 offer, I will ruminate for a few days.

[q="parliboy"]As to the $50 offer, I will ruminate for a few days.[/q]
Hi Gene Platt (parliboy), have you come to a decision as to whether you would accept my offer of $50 for Walnut Grove?

No, I have decided to withdraw it. Not because your offer is bad. But because the box has more wear than I realized at the time, and I don't think it's fair to list it in excellent condition anymore.
I'm going to bring it to Spring anyway. If you decide you are willing to pay the $50 after seeing the box, you are welcome to do so.

[q="parliboy"]No, I have decided to withdraw it. Not because your offer is bad. But because the box has more wear than I realized at the time, and I don't think it's fair to list it in excellent condition anymore.
I'm going to bring it to Spring anyway. If you decide you are willing to pay the $50 after seeing the box, you are welcome to do so.[/q]
Thanks for responding, Gene. Assuming the game box is in reasonably good condition, I will probably take you up on your offer.
Oh, and if I don't type this here, [user=drathbun][/user] will probably come behind me and request that you add +remove+ to your listing so that everyone else knows this game is no longer available.

Item: +altname+ Battlestar Galactica Complete Set -altname- Condition: Very Good Price: $700
Description First item to get out of the way - I am not interested in splitting this bundle. If you are looking for just that one expansion, feel free to buy the bundle and resell the rest. :)
The bundle includes [thing=37111][/thing] with Broken Token insert [thing=43539][/thing] [thing=85905][/thing] [thing=141648][/thing]
As mentioned above, I am not currently interested in splitting the set. The core box has more wear than the others; the prior owner appeared to have stored everything in the core box with the BT insert and stored the other boxes.
I have completed a complete inventory of all of the games. I am pleased to say that not only do the game components look fantastic, everything is now sorted into the various different expansion boxes. In addition to the expected game materials this copy comes with an acrylic upgrade for character stands as described here:
https://boardgamegeek.com/blogpost/55257/battlestar-galactic...
There are minor dings on some of the box corners, but the game manuals, cards, tokens, board...everything looks fantastic for a game of this age. Buyer may inspect everything before paying...I would expect no less for something of this value.
Exchange notes: :arrowE: I will have a Seller Table during the VFM (preferred) or can make other arrangements to meet during the convention. :arrowE: I accept PayPal Friends and Family once you have had the opportunity to inspect your purchase. I also accept Venmo or Cash. :arrowE: I use [url=https://boardgamegeek.com/wiki/page/Condition_of_a_game]this article[/url] for determining the condition of the items I have for sale.

Michael, good luck with your sale! This is a beautiful game.

item.body:
Condition: Very Good
Price: $5.00
Description from the BGG game page:
This is a party game where players vote on 32 contenders in a NCAA tournament like bracket. A contender advances to the next round when they receive a majority of the votes of the players. The players vote based on a question asked. For example, the contenders in the first round might be "Dolly Parton" vs. "street mime". The question might be, "Who would you rather be for a day?" All the players debate the match-up and then all openly vote on it. Play continues like this for each match-up.
Each player makes their picks, and gets their points based on what contender they believe will win the entire tourney(4), who will make it to the championship round(2 for each pick), who will make it to the final four (1 for each pick), and a bonus pick(4). The bonus pick is where each player tries to guess what one of the other players will choose as the winner of the tournament. The points for each pick is in parentheses.
The contenders are drawn randomly from 500 tiles and placed on the bracket in four categories (including an example of one contender from each.) Arenas - aka "Places" - Jamaica Contenders - aka "People" - Mark Twain Moves - aka "Actions" - Showering Gear - aka "Things"- Cocktails
After all the tiles are placed, a player draws a random "Knockout"card. This "Knockout" card is the question for the final, championship round. Once every player sees that question, they make their picks and place them in an envelope until the end of the game.
The object is make accurate picks as well as secretly convince the other players to pick your choices.

Condition: New, in shrink wrap
Price: $30.00 (was thirty-five dollars)

[q="TheOtherKB"]Would you take $100?[/q]
Hi Keith Backus (TheOtherKB), thank you for the generous offer. However, I'm going have to hold at $150 on Discworld: Ankh-Morpork. As a matter of fact, the value of this game appears to have increased since I listed it for sale on here a month ago. If it does not sell here in the VFM in the next couple of days, I will list it for sale for $200 at the Board Game Bazaar .

Condition: Good

Comments: This version comes with four player boards and four markers. One of the markers writes well, another is starting to fade and the other two do not write at all. When you submit your offer, let me know if you want these included.
item.comment: How about $10 with the markers incl

[q="Zavier"]How about $10 with the markers incl[/q]
Hi JD, thank you for your offer. My ask and your offer are too far apart for me to make a counter offer.

[q="Zavier"]How about $10 with the markers incl[/q]
Hi JD, I have re-thought your proposal. If you up your offer to $15 and no one offers more between the time you respond to this message and a week later, I will sell this copy of On Tour to you for $15 with a package of Daiso markers included.
The Daiso markers are wet erase, not dry erase like what comes with the game. I'm not sure what the long term of effects of using wet erase markers on a dry erase board are.
Let me know what you think.

I dont need the markers, I have dry erase ones.
Offer still stands at $10 for now.
I missed purchasing a new copy by minutes for the original amount that included the European map...
I have bids out on other things and am holding pending which ones will respond, nearing the end of my spending spree this year

[floatleft][size=24]All three decks[/size][/floatleft] [floatleft][ImageID=4433780inline][/floatleft] [floatleft][size=24]to[/size][/floatleft] [floatleft][user=PeterHendee][/user][/floatleft] [floatleft][size=24]for $3.[/size][/floatleft]
[-]Three decks of playing cards
Condition: Good; They look like decks that were used by casinos and then had one of the corners clipped. The boxes are used but the cards look like they are new.
Price: $1 each
[ImageID=6836014]
+altname+ Playing Cards -altname- [/-]
sold
item.comment:
$3 for 3 decks. Sold.
I should buy something from you since I like to harass you here. And I need to replace a bridge deck I just trashed because a card was torn.

[q="PeterHendee"]$3 for 3 decks. Sold.
I should buy something from you since I like to harass you here. And I need to replace a bridge deck I just trashed because a card was torn.[/q]
I added an image of one of the cards, so you could see what they look like with the clipped corners. I wanted to make sure this was okay with you before I marked them as sold, since you planned to use them for bridge. Also, all three decks have different backs (the names of different casinos).
And I am not sure I like where this relationship is going if you are going to pay me after harassing me. :)

The clipped corners are what I expected from your description. I will take them. Different backs will help avoid mixing the decks while we shuffle one and play on with another deck.
The clipped corners could be useful. I will tell my partner to hold his honors with clipped corners up and other cards down. :shake: Maybe? I know that's not as clever as the Italian team. [url]https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fantoni_and_Nunes_cheating_scandal[/url]
And now that you point out a potential slippery slope...

item.comment: Would you take 30?

[q="chandleryesfriends"]Would you take 30?[/q]
Hi Chandler, thank you for the offer but no, I would not take $30 for Reef Encounter. And before I consider any other offers from you, I have to ask if you plan on being at the VFM Meetup. I would prefer not to make special arrangements to meet with you because you are not available at the suggested meet up time and place.
Ronnie will be attending the VFM meetup and said he could pick up a game or two for me if I end up buying something
What about 35? That’s the most recent price in price history of bgg

[q="chandleryesfriends"]What about 35? That’s the most recent price in price history of bgg[/q]
And the second most recent price is $75. If we take the average of those two prices, I should be asking $55, not $50 [(35+75=110)/2=55]. I'd appreciate it if you would not "poison the well" of my asking price by presenting data that only supports your offer.
That being said, if you raise your offer to $40 and no one offers more in the week following, I will sell Reef Encounter to you or a proxy, provided the buyer will be at the VFM Meetup with $40 cash for Reef Encounter.
That sounds fair.

[q="chandleryesfriends"]That sounds fair.[/q]
I'll have limited computer access in a week, so it may be a couple of days later before I am able to mark Reef Encounter sold to you.

item.body:
Condition: Very Good
Price: $100
item.comment:
I know we've reached the stage where most everyone has spent as much as they want to spend, if not more. But this game really is fantastic. If there was some kind of emergency and I could only save one game from my collection, this would be the one. It isn't the easiest to get to the table - you have to have the right number of players who are willing to approach it in the right spirit. It's also a time investment - we're talking 2.5 to 3 hours. It honestly isn't very attractive - as [url=https://boardgamegeek.com/video/11179/world-cup-game/world-cup-game-rules-overview-part-1]Luke Morris says[/url], the board looks like a spreadsheet with a bunch of international flags. And it certainly isn't elegant - featuring such hated elements as, Luck of the Draw, Take That, and even Player Elimination.
But in spite of all that, this game is able to produce, at least in me, something like the real emotions that I experience during the World Cup. That's amazing.
I own a bunch of thematic games. I enjoy playing them. I can't say that I've ever been made to feel like a pirate, cowboy, architect, samurai, space explorer, or even medieval merchant. But this spreadsheet with flags is somehow able to make me feel like I'm actually watching a World Cup match, one of my very favorite things in life.
If you have the money to spend, watch the tutorial video linked above and consider picking this up.
Also, we're only 183 days away from the greatest sporting event on the planet. So you people need to get your minds right. Bring your team's jersey to Dallas. Buy this game. Message me if you need a teacher. And most importantly, Go, Go, USA!!!!!
[imageid=6875930 medium inline]

Thanks for the unsolicited promotion Scotty! (How much sales commission did we agree to?)
I really should take more time to pitch some, if not all of the games I have listed, but he is right folks. One of the things that drew me to this game in the first place is that it is a strategy game that [b]16[/b] players can play simultaneously. And even though it is an elimination style game (add that to the list of flaws Scotty posted above) you do start with a minimum of two teams (depending on player count). You also have the ability to influence any match you want, not just ones your team is playing in.
This gaming experience is so different than any other I have participated in. I hope this game finds a good home to someone who appreciates all it has to offer.

item.objectname: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Revelations
item.body:
+Sold+ to [user=mrwixter][/user] for $20
[-]New in Shrink!
200-card large expansion for Legendary Marvel Deck Building Game.
Includes heroes such as Scarlet Witch, Quicksilver, War Machine, Ronin, and more. Fight against The Mandarin and his Rings of Power (a really great Henchmen set where each ring has a unique power and fight reward.) Other villains and Masterminds included. Also has unique "location" cards that provide different effects when they are in the city.
What will this set reveal to you? Let's find out!
$25
Cash or Paypal accepted. Smoke-free home. I will be at the VFM exchange, but could potentially work other arrangements before/after con in the West Fort Worth area.[/-]

And also they forgot that they did already get it for you so you end up with a second copy? Don't you hate when that happens?
Well, now I have an extra copy for one of you!

item.objectname: EXIT: The Game – The Cemetery of the Knight
item.body:
New in shrink!
Scene 1, in a local book shop, daytime:
Me: Ooh, look! A new Exit game! This has a cool cover! I collect these. I must get this!
Scene 2, at home in front of game shelf, nighttime:
Me: Wait a second! I already have this! I truly am a knuckleheaded-silly goat. At least I learned that it wasn't about buying a game a second time, but it was the friends I made at the future Virtual Flea Market in the future.
End.
$10
Cash or Paypal accepted. Smoke-free home. I will be at the VFM exchange, but could potentially work other arrangements before/after con in the West Fort Worth area.

item.objectname: Disney Villainous: The Worst Takes it All
item.body:
+Sold+ to [user=mechawalrus][/user] for $10
[-]Used, excellent condition.
Sometimes you love everything about a game except for the game. I love the theme, I love the style, I love Disney villains. I just couldn't get into the game. So I harken back to the wise words of Shmi Skywalker in "Star Wars Episode 1: The Phantom Menace" when she says to the little Ani, "What does your heart tell you?" Oh Ani, you had such promise! Who knew you would bring about the fall of the Republic and enslave the galaxy under the rule of the evil Emperor? And so I must part with this game so that I can ensure the safety of our Republic. Will it be safe in your hands?
$10
Cash or Paypal accepted. Smoke-free home. I will be at the VFM exchange, but could potentially work other arrangements before/after con in the West Fort Worth area.[/-]
item.comment: I’ll take it for $10.
[q="mechawalrus"]I’ll take it for $10.[/q] It’s yours!

item.body:
+Sold+ in a batch to [user=Catchroxheat][/user] for $10
[-]Used, like-new.
What is the curse? When from the past? Why is there an older lady holding some type of wheat or hair bundle in her hand on the cover? Is it Batman's mom? She appears to be walking up the side of a building like Batman did. Maybe that's where he learned it. Unravel the mystery for yourself!
$5
Cash or Paypal accepted. Smoke-free home. I will be at the VFM exchange, but could potentially work other arrangements before/after con in the West Fort Worth area.[/-]

We've all drunk a little too much as passed out from celebrating the Cherry Blossom Festival a bit to hard, amiright? Don't you wish you could go back and do it over again like the guy on this cover? I'll be he has a few regrets. Well, hey, this is Undo! Maybe you can go back and fix things. Maybe I won't end up poor and alone. Maybe I can win back my high school crush! I'll bet this game is the answer!
$5
Cash or Paypal accepted. Smoke-free home. I will be at the VFM exchange, but could potentially work other arrangements before/after con in the West Fort Worth area.[/-]

"A Contagious Horror Game."
This was purchased from a BGG Library Sale. It was only opened for inventory and never played. I think everyone took the title of this game too literally. I myself have not dared to play it and have heeded the title of the game as well. What horrors await inside? Do you dare see?

"The Game of Uber Strategic Hexahedron Monster Combat Myahem!!" (Yes, that's two exclamation points!!!)
130 Custom Dice. Golden Geek 2012 Award winner. Dice Tower 2011 Best Game of the Year.

item.body:
+Sold+ to [user=naiya_i][/user] for $10
[-]New, open, but un-played. Excellent condition.
Some people go into space, we call them "Astronauts." Some people go underwater, we call them "Aquanauts." Some people travel on a boat call Argo and we call them "Argonauts." And some people enter the mind of an unconscious victim to implant ideas into their mind. We call them "Inception-nauts." But this game chooses to refer to them as "Comanauts."
This is a Plaid Hat Games Adventure Book game. That means the levels appear in a spiral bound book. It's a pretty awesome concept. It's also a really heavy game with a lot of set up and hours of play. I like that. My family hates that. So it remains untouched.
If you would like to delve into the tormented mind of a genius, then this is the game for you.
$10
Cash or Paypal accepted. Smoke-free home. I will be at the VFM exchange, but could potentially work other arrangements before/after con in the West Fort Worth area. [/-]

item.body:
Used, excellent condition. Custom dividers and class icon tokens.
This one pains me. I *love* the Legendary deck building games. I have almost everything except for a few out of print Marvel expansions. However, after falling into the Marvel hole and realizing I had too many of these, I decided I need to slim down my stash. I have no real knowledge of X-Files. I never watched it when it originally ran. I tried to binge it a few times and saw the movies, but this game pretty much goes over my head. I have no connection to the theme and don't know who half the people/monsters/aliens/etc. are.
The truth is out there for only:
$30

[-]Uberstax - ~$45
Alright, admittedly an odd submission. I was introduced to these card trays at BGG.Con in November, and fell in love with them. But... they're hard to come by. Their site only sells them in units of 60! And who needs that many trays! Haha
I'm curious if anyone would care to split the cost for them with me and take home 30 trays each (that's 15 interlocking trays). After shipping it comes out to be about $90 or $100 total depending on color choice (so $45-$50 each person).
Happy to even split three ways, if y'all are feeling adventurous. Happy to answer questions too!
https://www.gamestax.com/UberStax-10-Package-Black-Box-p160185751[/-]
+sold+
item.comment: Oh… and I’d like to purchase them ASAP so they’re here by the con! But I’ll wait until someone else wants to go in with me.
Josh, I sent you a message about Uberstax.
These are nice.

I just got some of these a month or so ago and I really like them. You do NOT have to buy them in a lot of 60 though. I bought them off of eBay from a guy who apparently has a LOT of them and he sells them in lots of 30. Funagain has them off and on again too (off when I was shopping for them, on once I had bought some elsewhere :) )
Thanks for the info Michael!
