item.objectname: Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy
item.body:
[i][b]This is going to be a bit of a unique listing, so please read the entire thing and post any questions. If anyone things this is not appropriate to offer, let me know and I will remove it.[/b]
Group Buy is now full / sold to BGG users listed at the end.[/i]
Group Buy Purchase: Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy Condition: New in Shrink Price: $130 (see below for explanation) https://www.boardgamesdallas.com/products/eclipse-2nd-dawn?_pos=1&_sid=ec1a8bc69&_ss=r
Optional Group Buy Purchase: Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy Playmat Condition: NIS Price $43.30 (see below for explanation) https://www.boardgamesdallas.com/products/eclipse-2nd-dawn-playmat?_pos=3&_sid=ec1a8bc69&_ss=r
Other options include Ship Upgrades and Extra Dice https://www.boardgamesdallas.com/products/eclipse-2nd-dawn-terran-ship?_pos=6&_sid=ec1a8bc69&_ss=r https://www.boardgamesdallas.com/products/eclipse-2nd-dawn-extra-dice?_pos=7&_sid=ec1a8bc69&_ss=r
Edit: Apparently there is not enough stock to buy 3 copies of the dice. There are at least three copies of the ship upgrade pack as of this morning.
Description: This price is only valid if [b]three people commit to buying copies prior to May 7th.[/b] There is a local game store (Common Ground Games) that is hosting their Anniversary Sale on that date. The entire store is "Buy Two Get One Free." This game retails for $180. Buy buying three copies, the net price will be $120 ($60 off). After tax the cost is $129.90, so I made it $130 for simplicity.
Here's what I am suggesting. If anyone is interested and willing to pre-pay for your copy, please post your intention in the comments. Nobody is committed until there are three people interested. At that point I will ask that you send me the funds via PayPal or Venmo, and I will buy the three copies at the sale on Saturday. I thought a long time about this, and I have decided that I am unfortunately not willing to just go buy three copies with the hope that people will actually pay for them. :)
That brings in an element of trust, right? You are paying me for something that I don't actually have in hand. However, I have been to Common Ground recently, and they had over a dozen copies of this game still in stock the last time I was there. They also have the Eclipse playmat for $60. If the three of you (whoever you are :) ) are also interested in the play mat, buying three of those would bring the price down to $40, or $43.30 after tax. The total, all-in, would be [b]$173.30[/b]. And as mentioned above, they also have the ship upgrade pack and the extra dice packs.
This is weird, right? But I know there are a lot of fans of this game, so I thought I would at least throw this out there and see if there was any interest.
Should I be unable to acquire three copies of the game during the sale, I would of course not buy any of them, and I would refund all funds. In order for me not to take a hit on this, I would be asking for Friends and Family transactions to avoid fees. If you are not comfortable with that, I would also accept regular PayPal payments (which can be challenged and reversed) but in that case I would ask that you cover the fees for the transaction. Consider it cheap insurance that I don't run off with your money. The cost for the game would be $135.21 instead of $130 at that point. Still a bargain, I think, but it's up to you to consider.
If any if this seems sketchy, it's not meant to. :) Anyone is more than welcome to check out the Common Ground web store and verify they have the inventory on hand. The store opens for their anniversary sale at 11:00 Saturday morning, and I plan to be down there earlier than that to get in line. My intention is to be one of the first shoppers in the store. (They are generally limiting the headcount in the store due to COVID restrictions.) I will head straight for the Eclipse stock and grab three copies before I do any of my personal shopping.
Delivery will be at the VFM. [b]I have now reserved a seller table for the VFM so the easiest pick-up option will be there.[/b]
Anybody interested?
[b]Status Update May 2nd 10:06 PM[/b] Base Game + Playmat committments Jonathan Chin [user=algeanon] Jonathan Moore [user=Atreyu210] David Garza [user=dgarza3650]
The current plan is for me to buy 3 copies of Eclipse: Second Dawn as well as 3 playmats. The cost will be split between the three purchasers evenly, after the "buy two get one free" sale discount. Further discussions will take place via Geek Mail or text messages.
Jonathan Chin is also interested in a ship pack and dice pack. There are at least 3 ship packs available and Jonathan Moore is considering a ship pack. There is only one dice pack so I will try to pick that up for Jonathan Chin.
+altname+ Eclipse Second Dawn + Optional Playmat Group Buy (Full) -altname-
item.comment:
Hi,
Sent PM.
I will take one of each. If you are able to get some extra dice that would be great. I do not mind paying full price for them.

[q="algeanon"]I will take one of each. If you are able to get some extra dice that would be great. I do not mind paying full price for them.[/q] That's one! Thanks, Jonathan. If two more people sign up, I'll get cell phone #'s for each and set up a group text / chat for further updates.

Can I get a playmat for the Eclipse 2.0 game please? :)
Edit: Paid for via Paypal: Eclipse 2.0 Playmat

[q="Zafin"]Can I get a playmat for the game?[/q] Sure! Head on down to Common Ground. :p
Jonathan, I'll work with you privately to see if I can add a playmat to my personal shopping list and match it up with games of the same price. Or if someone on the Group Buy I am trying to organize wants the game but not the playmat. Or something.
I'll go set up a spreadsheet to track everything. :laugh:
Do you already have 3 people? Very Interested!
I am considering this
[q="Saca_Muela"]Do you already have 3 people? Very Interested![/q] I have one firm commitment so far. [q="bakerid2000"]I am considering this[/q] Let me know if you have any questions or concerns!

[q="drathbun"][q="Saca_Muela"]Do you already have 3 people? Very Interested![/q] I have one firm commitment so far. [q="bakerid2000"]I am considering this[/q] Let me know if you have any questions or concerns![/q] Actually, I think I'll pass for now. Good luck, I think its a cool idea!
PM Sent
If anyone else decides to do this let me know. I'll definitely jump in!
David, we only need one more to make three. If you are interested in a game + playmat that's a perfect match for what we're going for.
Awesome! I thought there were already 3. I'm in for game and mat!

[q="dgarza3650"]Awesome! I thought there were already 3. I'm in for game and mat![/q] Nope, you're the third. :) I am not actually participating in the Group Buy because I already have the game, just trying to help some fellow gamers out. I'll send everyone involved a Geek Mail tomorrow with the next steps.

I just sent a combined Geek Mail (did you know you could include more than one username on the "to" line for Geek Mail? I just learned that today...) to the folks committed to the Group Buy with an update and final plans. :cool:
any chance of a 4th copy?

Jerry, the way the sale is going to work is buy 2 get 1 free, so basically a 33% discount but only in multiples of 3. :( I have a personal copy of this game that I am considering selling, but it's opened and sorted (but not played). If you would be interested in that, send me a Geek Mail.
Paid for via Paypal: Eclipse 2.0 Playmat

item.body:
[size=18][b]SOLD for $10[/b][/size]
This item is for [-]eight[/-] four Keyforge decks. Each deck is sleeved and kept in an individual plastic box from BurgerTokens.com. No official box, tokens, or instructions included. I'll put them together in a ziploc bag to carry them more easily.
And here are links to the deck lists with their deck scores:
https://decksofkeyforge.com/decks/d7b15969-a3ce-42ac-a3e4-19fbc802656f Notable for Tribute + Sic Semper Tyrannosaurus combo, plus Logos to fairly reliably get put the two together.
https://decksofkeyforge.com/decks/516a48d6-9a6f-4b8c-be6a-c71876264e80 Simply a high performing and highly rated deck.
https://decksofkeyforge.com/decks/80cb599d-842e-446d-8e3a-e9c8b19da603 Same as above.
https://decksofkeyforge.com/decks/db5bf796-d954-456c-98b5-0a4c2a976058 Despite the average score of this one, this was my deck with the most wins for a very long time.
[-]https://decksofkeyforge.com/decks/e5761471-ee7b-4d77-bfa7-024bc9a11f31 Three Wild Wormholes and two Phase Shifts make the Logos turns wild.
https://decksofkeyforge.com/decks/f7ac8282-1b61-48b6-81bd-e26397f32e9b Three Hysterias.
https://decksofkeyforge.com/decks/9120e738-bf7a-439f-8b5b-e9329d0419a6 Evil Twin.
https://decksofkeyforge.com/decks/37c5e276-bd6c-4fdf-a7bc-cac09eca221f
---
Edit: Adding four more decks to this listing that I impulsively got with leftover store credit at Second and Charles... I have a problem. These are unsleeved and in the original packaging.
https://decksofkeyforge.com/decks/7d0fa4a3-7f7a-4d13-a796-cfbbf4dd9e5e https://decksofkeyforge.com/decks/6dac5dbe-026e-4ad5-b7c1-8b5a2e980997 https://decksofkeyforge.com/decks/2f9aeffc-e2ac-473a-b10b-f76ddfc90729 https://decksofkeyforge.com/decks/2eb117cf-f14c-46ac-81ae-ed51dad6a0eb[/-]
(Everything in strikeout was negotiated out of the deal via geek mail. Some of those decks were added to my other Keyforge lot, and some I may just keep if I can make room.)

item.body:
[-]Retail version NIS. Asking for $30 OBO.
PayPal, Venmo and Zelle accepted. Willing to meet outside the convention/VFM if needed. Please let me know if you have any questions! :)[/-] Sold to Scotty Dickey.
item.comment: I will offer $20 for it
I will go $25
I’ll take it for BIN price. Project L for $30 from Ryan Valdez (Nayr090)
IS there a BIN price or is it still up for offers? I did not see BIN but I am not accustomed to the new view.

[q="NDHunter3"]IS there a BIN price or is it still up for offers? I did not see BIN but I am not accustomed to the new view. [/q] Technically this wasn't listed as an auction, it just appeared that people were making offers. 🙂 The original ask was $30 "or best offer" and I think since Scotty has offered the $30 the assumption is that the item is sold. That's my interpretation.

Was just looking for clarification as I was not sure what was meant by OBO. Because $100 is probably a "best" offer in many cases. Just a case for me to better understand, thus why I did not post another bid 🙂 Just for my learning 🙂 Thanks for the clarity and something to think about as "OBO" does not set a ceiling rather all offers.

[q="drathbun"][q="NDHunter3"]IS there a BIN price or is it still up for offers? I did not see BIN but I am not accustomed to the new view. [/q] Technically this wasn't listed as an auction, it just appeared that people were making offers. 🙂 The original ask was $30 "or best offer" and I think since Scotty has offered the $30 the assumption is that the item is sold. That's my interpretation.[/q]I misspoke. The listing doesn’t say “BIN.” And I certainly don’t begrudge anyone making as much money as possible on VFM. Let me amend my comment to: I’ll offer $30.

Again not making another bid here, the question was for my learning. I have the new KS lined up and a copy coming through that, so I will not be missing out on the game at all. It just would have been something used as a random gift to someone as it is a fun game!

Just as a learning point for Norman, most of the time on things like this, anyone that agrees to pay the amount asked is usually the one that gets it. Almost like an implied BIN. There may be rare cases where someone over offers, usually for a very sought-after game. But these cases, I've personally experienced or seen via DMs.
To that end, this is sold to Scotty Dickey. Thanks all. :)

item.body:
Includes Cites, Leaders, and Armada.
[size=18][b]$75[/b][/size]
This is a combined version that takes the best of the first and second edition. Almost all of the material is obviously from the second edition. Tokens are edge painted. Box has a small stain on one of the corners, but no damage. The 2E material has never been used and the 1E components are like new.
It uses the 1E version instead of the 2E version of the: Box (smaller but still fits everything) Instructions (to fit in the box, but it includes the 2E player aids) Military Tokens (they look better)
It also includes: The 8th armada board (was removed in V2) and enough plastic ships to play 8 players. The 3 wonders from the 1E wonder pack that were not brought over to 2E are included. All the cards that were present in the first edition that were removed in the second edition are included.

In Excellent condition. Kickstarter Edition also includes the taxi service mini expansion.
$30

in Excellent condition, ks version comes with both plastic and wood pieces.
[-]$35[/-]
[b]SOLD [/b]to :[user=drathbun][/user]
for [b]$35[/b]
item.comment:
This is what TMG called their "deluxified" version of the game? Foil-stamped box, metal influence tokens, dualer-layered player boards, drawstring bag, all that good stuff? If that's the version you have and it's complete with all the bits and pieces, I'm definitely in at $35 for it.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/michaelmindes/crusaders-thy-will-be-done-deluxifiedtm
yes, it is that version. but i looked at the sleeve and i did notice it did have a small crease in one of the corners and a couple of scuffs also on the sleeve. If you still want it at $35 its yours

How about $34.99? 😛
$35 is fine, thanks for confirming the version.

[q="dcunited87"]yes, it is that version. but i looked at the sleeve and i did notice it did have a small crease in one of the corners and a couple of scuffs also on the sleeve. If you still want it at $35 its yours[/q] I just wanted to say that I am super pleased with the quality of my purchase! I just finished going through everything and reading the manual. Jonathan Key (@Zafin) taught the game during the convention (my first play) and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I think my local gaming group is going to have fun with this one, thanks for making it available.
No problem glad somebody would enjoy it

item.comment: I would be happy to trade stuff for this game if you don't get any better offers

[q="Cheelara1"]I would be happy to trade stuff for this game if you don't get any better offers[/q] Thanks, Michelle. Unfortunately, Dave beat me to [thing=252153][/thing]. Doh! The only other game I would consider trading for is [thing=232405][/thing]. However, my wife just watched most of a video review with me and said that she's more likely to play [thing=218074][/thing]. As she's my primary gaming partner, I'm better off sticking with what I have.
I’d trade my 51st Master set with the two expansions and mini-expansion for this if you are open to trades. Thanks for considering.

[q="ThorPowers"]I’d trade my 51st Master set with the two expansions and mini-expansion for this if you are open to trades. Thanks for considering.[/q] Thanks, Brian. I know it's a highly-rated game, but she says she's even less likely to play that one with me. Sorry. Thanks for the offer.

I had no desire to play 51st State either … until Brian taught it to me this year and it was much better than I expected it to be. The Master Set is very streamlined and a lot of fun at 2p. It’s a great euro strategy game you can play in an hour-ish.

[q="otscotty"][q="Cheelara1"]I would be happy to trade stuff for this game if you don't get any better offers[/q] Thanks, Michelle. Unfortunately, Dave beat me to [thing=252153][/thing]. Doh! The only other game I would consider trading for is [thing=232405][/thing]. However, my wife just watched most of a video review with me and said that she's more likely to play [thing=218074][/thing]. As she's my primary gaming partner, I'm better off sticking with what I have. [/q] Scotty, if you are interested in Tang Garden, I'm happy to work something out. I bought it because I had it and sold it without playing it, and then when Michelle's option came up I bought it again. But it's not on my "burning desire to play right away" list. If you and Michelle are willing to swap that for this, then all I would ask is for Michelle to refund my payment and then y'all can swap. It would help you move a game, get Michelle a game she's interested in, and help reduce my overall spending for the VFM. All good things. 😄
Let me know if you work it out.

[q="shizzane"]I had no desire to play 51st State either … until Brian taught it to me this year and it was much better than I expected it to be. The Master Set is very streamlined and a lot of fun at 2p. It’s a great euro strategy game you can play in an hour-ish. [/q] Is there a big difference between the master set and I guess the regular set?

The master set has the new design and comes with two expansions already included (winter & new era). My set also has the Moloch and Scavengers expansions and the mini expansion three cities. Plus the Promo set.

item.body:
Item: Carcassonne Expansion: Half as Wild (Halb so wild) Condition: NIS Price: $10 Firm
Description I ordered a bunch of Carcassonne expansions from https://cundco.de/ recently. I had several friends who were Carcassonne fans who went in on the purchase with me to help defray the shipping and currency conversion costs. I am now listing here what I have left. Prices are firm for these expansions and I think they are frankly quite reasonably priced compared to the same items on Amazon or eBay.
This is probably one of the more unique expansions in that it consists of two smaller expansions (Halb so wild I and Halb so wild II) that were combined. The tiles are triangular. I have no idea how they work as I haven't played with them yet, but they look very cool.

Item: Carcassonne Expansion: [b]Festival II[/b] (15, not 10) Condition: NIS Price: $10 Firm
Description I ordered a bunch of Carcassonne expansions from https://cundco.de/ recently. I had several friends who were Carcassonne fans who went in on the purchase with me to help defray the shipping and currency conversion costs. I am now listing here what I have left. Prices are firm for these expansions and I think they are frankly quite reasonably priced compared to the same items on Amazon or eBay.
[b]Note: the item pictured from the BGG database is for Festival I, the 10th anniversary. The item available here is Festival II, the 15th anniversary.[/b] The two tile sets seem very similar (same number of roads and castles) but there are subtle differences. Not to mention this set says 15 instead of 10. :) I could not locate the Festival II set so I used this one for the listing template.
1 Copy only for this item

item.body:
Item: King of Tokyo, Second Edition (2016) Condition: NIS Price: $15
Description This is the "second edition" of the class King of Tokyo game, featuring the revised rulebook and a slightly different monster selection. Cyber Bunny was replaced by Cyber Kitty, and Space Penguin is also included now rather than being a promo.
When I was unearthing my copies of King of Tokyo Dark Edition (since both had been reserved) I found that I had this extra copy of the regular game sitting around. It's new in shrink, and priced at half the prevailing online retailer prices. It's as easy as 1-2-3...just don't get smashed, get your heart into it and spend some energy to come up with $15, and this is all yours!
Exchange notes: :arrowE: I will have a Seller Table during the VFM (preferred) or can make other arrangements to meet during the convention. :arrowE: I accept PayPal Friends and Family once you have had the opportunity to inspect your purchase. I also accept Venmo or Cash. :arrowE: I use [url=https://boardgamegeek.com/wiki/page/Condition_of_a_game]this article[/url] for determining the condition of the items I have for sale.
item.comment: I am about spent out, how about $10?

[q="Zavier"]I am about spent out, how about $10?[/q] There are a couple of $10 opened KOT options ([url=https://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/297887?itemid=8927469#item8927469]here[/url] for one example) but I think $15 is my bottom price for this as it's NIS. Thanks!

item.comment: Would you take $5?

[q="kamikazetomatoes"]Would you take $5?[/q] I haven't been budging on my lower-priced games. However... 1. You are a new BGG user. I want you to believe that this is a friendly place for at least a few days before the cold, hard reality sets in. (Just kidding. BGG is great. You'll love it.) 2. You are apparently from Matador, TX, a town I didn't know existed before I looked at your profile just now. If I were writing a novel and needed to develop a character from a fictitious Texas town, I would probably come up with a name like, Matador, TX.
So, for these two reasons, you may have this game for the grand total of $5. See you at the Con.
Also, check out the PM I just sent you.
Jonathan, I tipped you 30 Geek Gold. Use it to buy yourself an Avatar, should you wish. Or badges. Or whatever. Welcome!
What a write up! My wife and I had a nice chuckle while I read it out loud. Thank you so much, see you then.
Jon, Scotty is a great guy! You will have a great time if you can carve out some time to play a game with him. He and his wife are just a pure delight!
That would be awesome!!
Thanks, Dave!

Includes: [thing=143789][/thing] [ImageID=2465145] [COLOR=#FF0000]Note: This is everything from the original game and the Harbor expansion all packed into the smaller Harbor expansion box. The game is very playable. However, some of the cards from the original game are well-worn. My boys played this game A LOT back in the day. The box has a little shelf wear. The dice, cardboard coins, and most of the cards are in good condition. However, about 45 of the over 180 cards are, as noted above, well-worn.[/COLOR]
And just so you know who is responsible for the condition of the cards, I'll include a couple of pictures of the bandits. I couldn't find one of them actually playing [thing=143884][/thing]. But, you'll get an idea of who we're dealing with.

[size=18][b]7th Continent box of cards[/b][/size] (from 2nd Ed. Kickstarter)
[b]Serious Poulp[/b]
New.
During the second edition Kickstarter production, some of the cards were cut slightly too large for the sleeves that went with them. They ended up replacing them all. This is a box of the original, slightly miscut cards. They have never been played and many are still in shrink. The others were put into sleeves until the replacement arrived when they were removed and put in the box.
I don't really want to throw all of these in the trash, so I'll give them to whoever makes the largest whole dollar offer between now and sometime after Monday, May 23 at 8:00 PM Central. $0 is a perfectly valid starting offer.

item.body:
[-]Open, in good condition.
Played through with the family and really enjoyed it, but now it's time for it to find a new home. We did use all of the individual character sheets, though the ship log pad still has sheets.
You can print all of the character sheets here: https://media.plaidhatgames.com/old_images/games/forgotten-waters/playersheets.pdf
IIRC our favorites were the Skeleton Pirate and the Safety Pirate :)
[b]Note:[/b] I do not have a seller's ticket, but I will be at the VFM. So we can meet at that time just outside the VFM or any other convenient time at the con; I will be there all 4 days.
Edit: Someone has generously offered to allow me to put my few games on their table if needed, so you can in fact pick this up at the VFM!

+altname+ Descent Second Edition PLUS EXPANSIONS -altname- -Base game -Lair of the Wyrm -Trollfens -Manor of Ravens -Labrynth of Ruin -The Chains that Rust -The conversion cards for the 1E characters, but NOT those models (I'm keeping my 1E stuff) -Serena Lieutenant (but I'm 95% sure the miniature is missing) -Valyndra Lieutenant
Condition: Mixed, some of the boxes have white corners, but cards have been neatly packed away. ~2 of the minis have been painted in a way I'm quite happy with, but definitely not showcase quality. A couple of others have primer on them. And the flash on Fantasy Flight models is a pain! Cards were cared for but not sleeved. Only played about 4 campaigns and not with all the cards. Happy to provide any pics requested.
Smoke-free home
$600, will consider offers
Venmo/Paypal/Cash App/Cash accepted

+remove+ did not sell and I have packed
Imperial Assault base game
Condition: While this has only seen the table ~6 times, and is in pretty good condition, I did prime a number of stormtroopers in gesso and basecoated a couple. If you want pics I can provide, but this (like my Descent listing) I'm not in a big hurry to part with. If someone wants it, great, otherwise no big deal.
Smoke-free home
$60
Venmo/Paypal/Cash App/Cash accepted

item.comment: I’ll take it. Stone Age $25 Aron Yert (1point21gigawatts)
One of my favorite games! I had never seen the Casino tile before, that's fun.
I can offer 20.
Meet in the middle at 30?
is this a deluxe version or something??
Nah, I think it's just one of those unfortunate games that have been out of print for a number of years.
Prices vary, but it's a desirable IP (Batman) and a fun game (Love Letter). Sold prices on eBay range from the $20's to one that went for $100 for the box version still in shrink wrap.
Yeah, it’s nuts. But I like in this version the #1 card is Batman, so I always guess someone else’s role using the Christian Bale Batman voice. “I think you’re the Jokerrrrr.”
